verse:
चातुर्होत्रं कर्म शुद्धं प्रजानां वीक्ष्य वैदिकम् ।
व्यदधाद्यज्ञसन्तत्यै वेदमेकं चतुर्विधम् ॥

vedabase.translation: He saw that the sacrifices mentioned in the Vedas were means by which the people’s occupations could be purified. And to simplify the process he divided the one Veda into four, in order to expand them among men.
vedabase.purport: Formerly there was only the Veda of the name Yajur, and the four divisions of sacrifices were there specifically mentioned. But to make them more easily performable, the Veda was divided into four divisions of sacrifice, just to purify the occupational service of the four orders. Above the four Vedas, namely Ṛg, Yajur, Sāma, and Atharva, there are the Purāṇas, the Mahābhārata, Saṁhitās, etc., which are known as the fifth Veda. Śrī Vyāsadeva and his many disciples were all historical personalities, and they were very kind and sympathetic toward the fallen souls of this Age of Kali. As such, the Purāṇas and Mahābhārata were made from related historical facts which explained the teaching of the four Vedas. There is no point in doubting the authority of the Purāṇas and Mahābhārata as parts and parcels of the Vedas. In the Chāndogya Upaniṣad (7.1.4), the Purāṇas and Mahābhārata, generally known as histories, are mentioned as the fifth Veda. According to Śrīla Jīva Gosvāmī, that is the way of ascertaining the respective values of the revealed scriptures.

terms.चातुर्होत्रं कर्म शुद्धं प्रजानां: The fourfold sacrificial act is the pure duty of the people (praja).
terms.वीक्ष्य वैदिकम्: Looking upon it as Vedic (in origin and authority).
terms.व्यदधाद्यज्ञसन्तत्यै: They bestowed (vyadadhu) the unbroken lineage (santatya) of sacrifices (yajna).

gpt.meaning: This verse highlights the significance of the chaturhotra karma, the fourfold sacrificial act, in the Vedic tradition. The chaturhotra is considered the pure duty of the people (praja), implying that it is an essential practice for their spiritual and social well being. The term "Vedic" emphasizes the origin and authority of this act as prescribed in the Vedic texts. The verse also mentions that the unbroken lineage of sacrifices were maintained by practicing the chaturhotra. Finally, it points out that the Vedas, though one in essence, are fourfold in nature, reflecting the different aspects and branches of Vedic knowledge.

bard.meaning: Four-fold Vedas establishes the Vedic sacrifice for continuity of pure actions and looking at the people.
